page.title: 11Housing.Scremerston.
page.content: Most of the housing in the village was provided by local mine owners during the early part of this century. During the 1940s and 1950s the local{Council}started to build houses and included in this scheme were some sheltered housing for old people and bungalows for the{disabled. The sheltered housing is called Armstrong Court and there are 24 flats with a warden's flat.Most of the old people live there and they have a common room where they can all meet together. Other houses in the village are owned by the{Greenwich Hospital Estate and some are private houses. The Youth Leader lives in the old School House and a doctor lives in the Old Vicarage and Scremerston now comes under the vicar of Spittal.
